constraints.reason: Realistic upper bound for living adults

grounding.source: https://www.census.gov/newsroom/press-releases/2024/population-estimates-age-sex.html; US median age surpassed 39 in 2024 (Census); adult-only population skews older
grounding.note: Adult-only distribution (18+) shifts mean upward from ~39 national median to ~47. Normal approximation is reasonable; true distribution is slightly right-skewed due to baby boomer cohort. Std of 17 ca...[truncated]

grounding.source: https://usafacts.org/articles/what-percentage-of-the-us-population-is-transgender/ ; Gallup 2024 LGBTQ+ data; Census sex at birth data
grounding.note: Census reports ~50.5% female, ~49.5% male by sex at birth. Non-binary/Other estimated at ~1.6% based on USAFacts citing 1.70% non-binary adults and ~0.8% transgender adults; small overlap assumed. Mal...[truncated]

constraints.reason: Categorical weights must sum to 1 (tolerance for rounding across 51 entries)

grounding.source: https://www.census.gov/newsroom/press-kits/2024/national-state-population-estimates.html; Vintage 2024 Census state population estimates
grounding.note: Weights derived proportionally from Census Vintage 2024 state population totals. CA ~12%, TX ~9%, FL ~6.6%, NY ~6.0%, etc. DC included as distinct entry. Minor rounding applied to keep array manageabl...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau 2024 National Population by Characteristics; ACS 2023 race/ethnicity estimates
grounding.note: White non-Hispanic ~59.4%, Hispanic ~19.1%, Black ~12.4%, Asian ~6.3%, Other (AIAN, NHPI, multiracial) ~2.8%. These are well-established from decennial census and ACS.

grounding.source: Big Five personality meta-analyses (Soto & John 2017; US normative samples); IPIP-NEO population norms
grounding.note: US adult Big Five norms show moderate-high openness population mean (~0.54 on 0-1 scale). Beta(6.5,5.5) yields mean ~0.54, std ~0.12, bounded [0,1]. Slight right skew reflects cultural emphasis on ope...[truncated]

grounding.source: Big Five US normative data; Soto et al. (2011) JPSP; IPIP-NEO standardization samples
grounding.note: Conscientiousness tends to be moderately high in US adults (mean ~0.58 on 0-1 scale). Beta(7,5) yields mean ~0.583, std ~0.11. Increases with age; US culture rewards self-discipline.

grounding.source: Big Five US normative data; Rentfrow et al. (2013) regional personality study; IPIP norms
grounding.note: Extraversion is roughly symmetrically distributed with US mean ~0.50. Beta(5.5,5.5) is symmetric with mean 0.5, std ~0.12. US is moderately extraverted as a culture.

grounding.source: Soto & John (2017) JPSP; McCrae & Costa normative Big Five data; US IPIP norms
grounding.note: Agreeableness averages moderately high in US adults (~0.58). Increases with age. Beta(7,5) approximates this distribution well. Women score higher on average than men.

grounding.source: Soto & John (2017); Costa & McCrae US normative samples; APA/IPIP Big Five studies
grounding.note: Neuroticism mean ~0.42 in US adults (below midpoint). Decreases with age. Beta(5,7) yields mean ~0.417, std ~0.11. Scores higher in younger adults, females, and those with mood disorders.

grounding.source: Census Bureau Urban/Rural classification 2020; Pew Research 2018 urban-rural typology; USDA ERS rural definitions
grounding.note: ~80% of Americans live in urban areas per Census, but Census urban includes dense suburbs. Using sociological definition: ~31% core urban, ~55% suburban, ~14% rural. Reflects that 80% urbanized land s...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau CPS 2023; ACS 2023 Educational Attainment for adults 25+; BLS Education and Training data
grounding.note: 2023 CPS data: ~8.8% less than HS, ~27.2% HS diploma only, ~16.2% some college no degree, ~10.3% associate's, ~23.2% bachelor's, ~14.3% graduate/professional. These match ACS 2023 for adults 25+, appl...[truncated]

constraints.reason: Extreme outlier cap; preserves top earners but excludes billionaires

grounding.source: US Census Bureau CPS ASEC 2023; median household income $74,580 (2023); ACS 2023 income distribution
grounding.note: Log-normal with ln-mean=11.0 and ln-std=0.75 yields median ~$60,496 and mean ~$80,000, consistent with CPS 2023 median of ~$74,580 for all households. Conditioned on education and state in actual samp...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau CPS 2023 Marital Status tables; ACS 2023; Pew Research Center marital trends 2023
grounding.note: CPS 2023: ~31.8% never married, ~48.5% married/spouse present, ~10.5% divorced, ~5.8% widowed, ~3.4% domestic partnership/separated. Widowed high due to older adult skew in simulation.

constraints.reason: Minimum one person (the agent) in household
Realistic maximum household size; preserves extended family outliers

grounding.source: US Census Bureau 2023 CPS; ACS 2023 Average Household Size = 2.53
grounding.note: Average US household size is 2.53 per ACS 2023. Normal approximation with std=1.3 captures the spread from singles (32%) to large families. Should be rounded to integer in sampling. Min=1 enforced as ...[truncated]

constraints.reason: Cannot have children in household with only 1 person

grounding.source: US Census Bureau CPS 2023; CDC NCHS family structure data; Pew Research 2023 parenting statistics
grounding.note: ~40% of US households have children under 18 present. CPS 2023 shows 38-42% of family households have own children under 18. Probability set at 0.40 for adult population 18+, age-conditioned in practi...[truncated]

grounding.source: BLS Current Population Survey 2024; BLS Employment Situation 2024; Census CPS ASEC 2023
grounding.note: BLS 2024: labor force participation ~62.5%, unemployment rate ~3.9%. Of adults 18+: Full-time ~46.2%, Part-time ~10.1%, Self-employed ~9.3% (BLS alt measures), Unemployed ~3.6%, Retired ~24.5% (includ...[truncated]

grounding.source: BLS Occupational Employment and Wage Statistics (OEWS) 2023; BLS Current Population Survey 2024
grounding.note: BLS OEWS 2023 major occupational groups. 'Other' includes Transportation, Healthcare support, Protective service, Farming, and other BLS categories not explicitly listed. Management ~10.7%, Profession...[truncated]

grounding.source: Gallup Party Identification 2024; Pew Research Political Typology 2023; ANES 2024 pre-election survey
grounding.note: Gallup 2024: ~28% Democrat, ~27% Republican, ~43% Independent (but many lean). Using 5-point scale with leaners: Strong Dem 17.5%, Lean Dem 15.5%, Pure Independent 27%, Lean Rep 14.5%, Strong Rep 25.5...[truncated]

grounding.source: Gallup Ideology Tracking 2024; Pew Research American Values Survey 2023; ANES 2022 self-placement
grounding.note: Gallup 2024: ~25% Liberal, ~36% Moderate, ~38% Conservative (combined). Five-category breakdown: Very Liberal ~8.5%, Liberal ~19.5%, Moderate ~35%, Conservative ~23.5%, Very Conservative ~13.5%. Conse...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Religious Landscape Study 2023-2024; PRRI American Values Atlas 2023; GSS 2022
grounding.note: Pew 2023-24: Evangelical Protestant ~24%, Mainline Protestant ~13%, Catholic ~20%, Other Christian ~6%, Jewish ~1.8%, Muslim ~1.1%, Other Non-Christian ~4.1%, Unaffiliated/None ~30%. 'Nones' now the l...[truncated]

grounding.source: Gallup Church Attendance 2023-2024; Pew Research Religious Practices 2023; GSS religious attendance 2022
grounding.note: Gallup 2024: ~22% attend weekly or more, ~12% monthly, ~17% seldom, ~27-30% never. Pew similarly finds ~45% seldom or never. Distributed across 6 categories consistent with Gallup/Pew trend data.

grounding.source: Pew Research News Platform Fact Sheet 2024; Reuters Institute Digital News Report 2024 (US); Nielsen Media Research 2023
grounding.note: Pew 2024: TV ~29% primary, Online/Digital ~31%, Social Media ~20%, Radio ~7.5%, Print ~5.5%, None/Don't follow news ~6.5%. Trend shows digital/social growing, TV declining, print nearly extinct for pr...[truncated]

grounding.source: AllSides Media Bias Ratings 2024; Pew Research Media Habits 2023; Reuters Digital News Report 2024 US
grounding.note: Pew finds roughly symmetric partisan media consumption but many use multiple sources. AllSides/Reuters suggest ~26% primarily left-leaning outlets, ~24.5% right-leaning, ~19.5% centrist, ~30% mixed or...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Social Media Use 2024; Statista US social media platform usage 2024; Comscore digital audience data 2024
grounding.note: Pew 2024 US adults: Facebook ~68% use (primary for ~30%), YouTube ~83% use (primary ~20%), Instagram ~47% use (primary ~17%), TikTok ~33% use (primary ~12%), Twitter/X ~22% use (primary ~9%), None/min...[truncated]

constraints.reason: Hard physical limit on waking hours

grounding.source: DataReportal Digital 2024 US Report; Pew Research social media time 2023; Statista US daily social media usage 2024
grounding.note: US adults average ~2.3 hours/day on social media (DataReportal 2024). Log-normal with ln-mean=1.0, ln-std=0.75 gives median ~2.72 hrs and mean ~3.1 hrs but with right-skew capturing heavy users. Adjus...[truncated]

grounding.source: FCC Broadband Progress Report 2024; Pew Research Internet Access 2024; NTIA Internet Use Survey 2023
grounding.note: Pew 2024: ~77% have home broadband, ~14% smartphone-only access, ~7% no internet at home. FCC 2024 shows dial-up/satellite at ~4%. Adjusted: Broadband 74.8%, Mobile Only 13.8%, Dial-up/Satellite 4.2%,...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Election Assistance Commission 2022; Census Voting and Registration Survey 2022; AmeriCorps Volunteering & Civic Life 2023
grounding.note: 2020 election had ~67% turnout of registered voters; 2022 midterm ~47%. CPS Voting Survey 2022: ~50% reported voting. Of non-voters, many are rarely/never. Active volunteers/campaigners ~13% per Ameri...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau Housing Vacancies and Homeownership Survey Q3 2024; ACS 2023 homeownership rate
grounding.note: US homeownership rate Q3 2024 was 65.6% per Census Housing Vacancy Survey. ACS 2023 confirms ~65.5%. Consistent across multiple sources. Conditioned on age, income, marital status in actual sampling.

grounding.source: KFF Health Insurance Coverage 2023; Census Bureau CPS ASEC 2023 Health Insurance; CMS Enrollment Data 2024
grounding.note: KFF/Census 2023: Employer-sponsored ~49%, Medicaid ~17.5%, Medicare ~15.5%, ACA/Individual ~5.2%, Military/VA ~2.5%, Uninsured ~10.3%. Uninsured rate fell to ~7.7% in 2023 by some measures; using 10.3...[truncated]

grounding.source: US Census Bureau ACS 2023 Nativity and Citizenship; DHS Yearbook of Immigration Statistics 2023
grounding.note: ACS 2023: ~84.7% native-born, ~7.4% naturalized citizens, ~4.0% legal permanent residents, ~3.9% other (visa holders, undocumented est., etc.). Foreign-born total ~15.3% of US population. These are ad...[truncated]

grounding.source: BLS Union Members Summary January 2024; BLS Economic News Release UNEMPL 2024
grounding.note: BLS January 2024: Union membership rate was 10.0% of wage and salary workers, representing 14.4 million workers. For all adults (including retired/unemployed) the effective rate is slightly lower; usi...[truncated]

grounding.source: Gallup Gun Ownership Poll 2023-2024; Pew Research Gun Ownership Survey 2023; Washington Post-Ipsos poll 2023
grounding.note: Gallup 2024: ~43% of households report having a gun. Pew 2023: ~32% of adults personally own a gun, ~44% live in gun-owning household. Using 32% personal/household ownership as conservative estimate c...[truncated]

grounding.source: Gallup Confidence in Institutions 2024; Edelman Trust Barometer 2024 US; Pew Research Trust in Government 2023
grounding.note: Trust in major institutions at historic lows. Gallup 2024: confidence in Congress 8%, Supreme Court 37%, presidency 38%, media 31%. Edelman 2024 US Trust Index ~48/100. Beta(3,5) yields mean ~0.375, s...[truncated]

grounding.source: Cacioppo & Petty NCS normative data; Fleischhauer et al. (2010) NCS meta-analysis; educational attainment correlates
grounding.note: Need for Cognition scale (Cacioppo & Petty 1982) shows roughly normal distribution in general population. Mean approximately at midpoint (0.50) with symmetric Beta(5.5,5.5). Correlated with education ...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pennycook & Rand (2019) misinformation susceptibility research; Reuters Institute Digital News Report 2024 media literacy; Knight Foundation media literacy surveys 2023
grounding.note: Misinformation susceptibility is inversely related to media literacy. Research suggests majority are moderately susceptible; a minority (highly media-literate) are resistant and a minority are highly ...[truncated]

grounding.source: Simulation specification: 'in US'
grounding.note: Universal constant per simulation specification. All agents are US residents. No sampling variation.
